Posts.Content: Sorry for the moan.  So I finally got referred for suspected lymphodema in my arm. This is after the hosp I am being treated in didn’t want to bother, check me out or refer me. They then referred me to the wrong local authority. When I eventually got to see a nurse at a new hospital in a new area she was fantastic. I couldn’t praise her enough. Caring, kind, empathetic. Everything that has been missing from almost every step of treatment and care plan at original hosp.  I was so pleased I was being treated with respect and being listened to.  I have written a letter to my oncologist about the whole, sorry saga. He said ‘it is regrettable that you feel you have not been listened to.’ My lymphodema nurse has almost returned my faith in things.  Happy Sunday to you all xx
Posts.Title: Different hospital=different quality of treatment

Posts.Content: Yay. Result. Well done xx
Posts.Title: A moan if I may !

Posts.Content: You are NOT being a diva. You have every right to feel angry and upset by this treatment, as does your husband. There’s no excuse whatsoever for shoddy treatment or lack of care.  Hope you complain.  Hope you feel better soon x
Posts.Title: A moan if I may !

Posts.Content: Boobarama- brilliant name! Love it!
Posts.Title: Woohoo!

Posts.Content: just finished my last rads booster. Thank god it's done.
Posts.Title: Woohoo!

Posts.Content: Hi Barfy, My oncologist told me the % of my cancer returning if I stopped the anastrozole was 2% higher than with it.  Hope you’re ok xx
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply Maggie.  On my baseline scan I was in the Amber bit for osteopenia. I pointed this out to my oncologist but as he hadn’t bothered to bring the scan results into the room with him he couldn’t really comment or advise!!! Good luck to you too.
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Mine said the same when pushed to give an answer which he didn’t want to do-2 to 3%.
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Went in to this as you said you’d posted about it here in response to my post.  At least you've given it over a year. I haven't even Been able to manage 3 months.  It’s just so awful, esp now the pains have started in my joints, fingers, legs.  Glad you’re feeling better off it and hope it goes ok if you try the other one xx
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: hello all. Hope everyone is good today.  I spent another sleepless night in pain, sweating like I was in the Sahara.  The pharmacist has changed my Letrozole and my brand of Venlafaxine. The Letro change I get, as Actavis and and Accord have merged but why change the Venlaf when the brand I was on for months was working and at least making life manageable. I’m sick of asking to talk to the pharmacist, I’m sick of fighting for tablets that are the best for me. I’m sick of feeling dread, having to look in my bag of medication and wondering what I’m going to get this time. I’m sick of going to the gp and begging for help.  Sorry for the moan.  I’m off to see Ed Sheeran today. Hurrah for that.  Happy Saturday xx
Posts.Title: Tired of fighting for the least evil tablets

Posts.Content: Thanks so much. I’d read that they were the worst x rays for radiation. But I think it’s got to be done, to be sure.  Thanks. Xx
Posts.Title: Worried about x rays post radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hello all.  My dentist has suggested I need x rays on my teeth but I am worried about this after having rads. I feel more radiation going into my body is a bad thing.  Any advice?  Thanks Jane xx
Posts.Title: Worried about x rays post radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Totally with you Lucy. Very frustrating. And you don't want to keep talking about the fact that this is your life now. People don't want to hear stuff like that.  Someone said to me today 'chin up, it'll all work out in the end.' Thought I'd wondered into a Disney movie. They were just being positive I guess.  Good luck with everything. Hugs to you xx
Posts.Title: Annoyed!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hello Pink sister, The manufacturers’ makes deffo have an impact on side effects. My pharmacist went through the inserts with me to try and find what might be causing my side effects.  I’ve been on Actavis letrozole for a few months now, after an horrific time on 6 different brands of anastrozole. I’ve just been told Actavis and Accord have merged so I can’t get the brand was the the favoured one for me anymore. Gutted as I had an awful time on Accord anastrozole.  Go chat to your pharmacist and change your brand.  Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Letrozole Brands and side effects

Posts.Content: I’m so sorry and truly sad to read your post. I don’t know what to say to you. Is there anyone nearby you can talk to, ask for help from? Family members? I’m sending you massive hugs and positive thoughts xx
Posts.Title: I just cant take anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Sam, I was told same as you-15 sessions. Then went for measuring up to find I was getting 3 extra boosters. I contemplated not having them but I did. They were no different. But I would’ve liked to have all the info before I started out to prep myself.  Hope the rads goes well xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy boosters?

Posts.Content: Hello all.  Got my diagnosis a couple weeks ago and just been for my pre-op. Sadly been told op won't go ahead because no one told me to stop taking evening primrose and starflower oil. Am devastated. Just want it over with.  Jane
Posts.Title: Diagnosed and scared.

Posts.Content: Thanks Jackie. Totally gutted about reason for delay though. Could've been avoided. Frustrating.  Thanks for your reply.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed and scared.

Posts.Content: Love him. ❤️
Posts.Title: Petrified about 1st year mammo check

Posts.Content: hello.  Can’t sleep thinking about my 1st year anniversary mammogram. My boob is so sore although rads finished last October. Boob is hard and totally diff shape now. I have scar tissue that is also painful.  I know this mammogram is going to be painful. The BCN says take paracetamol the day before to prep.  I can’t even give people hugs from that side of my body as it hurts too much.  Paracetamol isn’t going to cut it. Even the stronger stuff.  I know I have to have it but am a bit scared and sad.  Hope you’re all getting some sleep.  Jane xx
Posts.Title: Petrified about 1st year mammo check

Posts.Content: Hi LondonLass, Thanks for reply. Guess you can’t sleep either! I will do my meditation and all the things you say. Like all things, the thing will pass.  Thanks for your kind words xx
Posts.Title: Petrified about 1st year mammo check
